alert.note: Alert for Northern Rocky Mountain Front; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 06 at 2:34AM MST until January 06 at 3:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THIS MORNING TO MIDNIGHT MST TONIGHT... ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO MIDNIGHT MST FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Winter storm and Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations between 5 and 10 inches at lower elevations and 10 to 20 inches in the mountains. Winds gusting as high as 65 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. * WHERE...The Rocky Mountain Front. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 6 AM this morning to Midnight MST tonight. For the Blizzard Warning, from Midnight tonight to Midnight MST Friday Night. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 3 PM MST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Visibilities may drop below 1/4 mile due to falling and blowing snow. Whiteout conditions are expected and will make travel treacherous and potentially life-threatening. Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Northern Rocky Mountain Front; Southern Rocky Mountain Front
